intro: Tessenia subcostata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed tessenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish or greenish hue. Tessenia subcostata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
